descricao: The Jasmine Star Show is a conversational business podcast that explores what it really means to turn your passion into profits. Law school dropout turned world-renowned photographer and expert business strategist, host Jasmine Star delivers her best business advice every week with a mixture of inspiration, wittiness, and a kick in the pants. On The Jasmine Star Show, you can expect raw business coaching sessions, honest conversations with industry peers, and most importantly: tactical tips and a step-by-step plan to empower entrepreneurs to build a brand, market it on social media, and create a life they love.

episodios.titulo: Turn Business (and Personal) Rejection Into Redirection
episodios.descricao: I‚Äôm going to be real with you‚Äîsometimes the biggest business breakthroughs don‚Äôt happen on stage, in a meeting, or during a strategy session. They happen when your feelings get hurt, your plans go sideways, and you say ‚Äúyes‚Äù anyway.In this episode, I‚Äôm sharing the behind-the-scenes story of how a last-minute trip to Nashville turned into one of the most impactful mastermind experiences of my year‚Äîall because I chose to show up, even when I felt excluded.Here‚Äôs the tea: I wasn‚Äôt invited to a mastermind dinner I thought I‚Äôd be part of. And, like any human with a beating heart, I had a lot of feelings. I let myself sit in them. I reached out to my girl Amy Porterfield. And instead of letting the exclusion define me, I made a new story‚Äîand booked a plane ticket.Spoiler: That trip led to a powerful mini mastermind with some of the most brilliant female entrepreneurs I know (Jenna Kutcher, Bonnie Christine, and more), and I walked away 1% better‚Äîand with 5 key takeaways you can apply to your business today.Here‚Äôs what you‚Äôll learn:Why rest is just as productive as hustleHow to reframe moments of rejectionWhat ‚Äúchoosing a better story‚Äù looks like in actionThe power of informal opportunitiesHow to squeeze value out of every experience (even the ones that don‚Äôt go as planned)Whether you're navigating disappointment or wondering if it‚Äôs worth hopping on a plane last-minute, I hope this episode encourages you to trust the process and say yes to what could be next.Because the truth is, the right rooms won't just open for you‚Äîthey‚Äôll find you when you're ready.Click play to hear all of this and:[00:54] Why Rejection Hurt: Unpacking a Business Exclusion[02:44] Choose a Better Story: How I Reframed the Narrative[03:42] How Vulnerability Sparked a New Opportunity[04:32] The 1% Rule: Why Small Gains Lead to Big Growth[05:28] 32 Hours in Nashville: High-Energy Learning & Connections[08:04] Informal Masterminds Matter: What This Trip Taught Me[10:22] Why Being Present (Even When Disappointed) Still Pays OffListen to Related Episodes:Three Ways to Remove Comparison and Become UnstoppableBuilding Confidence with Ease: How I‚Äôm Becoming the 3X Version of Myselfüìß Join my Newsletter for a weekly cocktail of insider business strategy, personal reflections, and the journey of being a thought leader: https://jasminestar.com/newsletter üìßFor full show notes, visit jasminestar.com/podcast/episode560

episodios.titulo: The Power of Blank Space: How I Doubled My Growth by Doing Less
episodios.descricao: What if the best thing you could do for your business this year‚Ä¶ was do less?In this raw, behind-the-scenes episode, I‚Äôm sharing how intentionally creating blank space in my calendar‚Äînot a break, not a vacation, but a purposeful pause‚Äîcompletely transformed my business growth.You‚Äôll hear how stepping back led to major clarity, a game-changing mastermind invite with Brendon Burchard, and a bold new approach to my product suite and funnels. I also dive into the power of Deep Work Days, why ‚Äúbusy‚Äù isn‚Äôt always better, and how to stop overcommitting and start expanding.This isn‚Äôt a framework. It‚Äôs real-time documentation of a massive mindset shift.If you‚Äôve ever felt stuck in hustle mode, this is your permission slip to do things differently in 2025.Click play to hear all of this and:[00:01] Why creating blank space‚Äînot hustle‚Äîis the most powerful thing I‚Äôve done in 2025 [02:45] The distinction between rest, recharge, and true blank space [04:10] What happened when I blocked off three weekdays and actually honored that time [05:30] How a random text to Brendon Burchard led to a game-changing mastermind invite [06:45] The major funnel and product suite shifts we made because of that blank space [08:15] Why courage (not time) is what you need to create space for your next level [09:00] What I do during my new ‚ÄúDeep Work Days‚Äù and why they matter more than I expectedListen to Related Episodes:How to Double Your Energy and Focus with Tanessa Shearsüìß Join my Newsletter for a weekly cocktail of insider business strategy, personal reflections, and the journey of being a thought leader: https://jasminestar.com/newsletter üìßFor full show notes, visit jasminestar.com/podcast/episode557You know that feeling when you find a platform that just works‚Äîand you never have to worry about switching? episodios.titulo: Mind Pumped: The Entrepreneurial Truth About Value, Vision, and Monetization with Adam Schafer
episodios.descricao: In this episode, I sit down with Adam Schafer‚Äîco-founder of the Mind Pump Podcast and serial entrepreneur‚Äîfor a real-talk convo on building an 8-figure brand without outside funding. We dive into how he and his partners grew a scrappy podcast into a thriving business by leading with value, staying consistent, and building community.We chat about why bootstrapped founders often downplay their success, how to monetize after proving your value, and the key differences between business, team, and personal branding. If you've ever questioned whether your slow start is worth it‚Äîthis episode is your reminder to keep going.Click play to hear all of this and:[03:58] How two bootstrapped entrepreneurs realized their path was the one others envied[05:41] The mission behind Mind Pump and how they started with zero expectations[08:18] The 3-part framework Adam used to build value before monetizing[13:20] How they monetized their podcast after proving the market[15:45] Navigating business with multiple partners‚Äîand still liking each other[21:11] Why consistency and community matter more than polish at the startListen to Related Episodes:How to Build Your Personal Brand as a High-Achieving EntrepreneurHe Built a Multimillion-Dollar Business Using THIS Content Strategy ft. episodios.titulo: Who Am I Not To? A Mindset Shift to Overcome Imposter Syndrome
episodios.descricao: Have you ever looked around your business, your dream, your life and thought: ‚ÄúWho am I to be here?‚ÄùYeah. Me too.This episode is a raw, real, and honest repurposed interview from when I was a guest on the Go Getters Podcast with my southern soul sister, Kayse Morris. And we‚Äôre tackling something that every single entrepreneur deals with‚ÄîImposter Syndrome.You know that voice‚Äîthe one that says:You‚Äôre not good enough.Someone else is already doing it.What if you fail?Who do you think you are?I‚Äôve been there. And in this conversation, I share the exact mindset shift that helped me silence that voice and finally start moving forward with boldness.Instead of asking, ‚ÄúWho am I to‚Ä¶?‚ÄùI began asking, ‚ÄúWho am I not to?‚ÄùLet that sit for a moment.üëÜ That right there became my daily reminder: I was born for this.Not because I had all the answers, funding, experience, or confidence.But because I was willing to show up, learn as I went, and take action even when I was terrified.You‚Äôll also hear me share:The weight of being a first-generation Latina entrepreneurWhat it felt like to wear ‚Äúimposter syndrome‚Äù like a varsity jacketHow being scared is actually a sign you‚Äôre doing something bigWhy confidence isn‚Äôt a prerequisite‚Äîit‚Äôs a result of consistent actionIf you‚Äôve ever doubted yourself, this is your pep talk in podcast form.Let‚Äôs throw off the jacket of fear, stop waiting for permission, and remind ourselves that we were made for more.Click play to hear all of this and:[00:59] Why imposter syndrome hits harder than we expect‚Äîand how to define it in a way that resonates.[02:24] My "varsity jacket" analogy that perfectly illustrates how imposter syndrome lingers.[03:19] The mindset shift that changed everything: ‚ÄúWho am I not to do this?‚Äù[03:39] Does confidence come naturally? Jasmine sets the record straight (and shares her hilarious ‚Äúlawyer from birth‚Äù story).[05:10] Why being scared doesn‚Äôt mean you‚Äôre not ready‚Äîit means you‚Äôre doing something meaningful.[06:50] My advice for entrepreneurs still waiting to feel ‚Äúready.‚Äùüìß Join my Newsletter for a weekly cocktail of insider business strategy, personal reflections, and the journey of being a thought leader: https://jasminestar.com/newsletter üìßFor full show notes, visit jasminestar.com/podcast/episode537

episodios.titulo: Turning Down Revenue: When Intuition Outranks Logic in Business
episodios.descricao: There‚Äôs something that feels almost criminal about saying no to a good opportunity, right?It looks great on paper, it‚Äôs in alignment with your goals, the money is forecasted, the deliverables are clear, and you‚Äôve even mentally committed to it‚Ä¶ but something inside you says, ‚ÄúThis isn‚Äôt it.‚ÄùThat happened to me recently, and in this episode, I‚Äôm pulling back the curtain on the decision I made to walk away from a highly aligned opportunity‚Äîand why.Let me be clear: this wasn‚Äôt just any opportunity. It was one we‚Äôd already factored into our 2025 revenue plan. It was a perfect fit on paper, and I‚Äôd been expecting (and prepping for) the call for months.But here‚Äôs the thing‚Ä¶ when it came time to sign the dotted line, I couldn‚Äôt do it.It made no logical sense. And my COO? She was stunned.But as I explain in this episode, I believe our bodies are pattern-spotting machines. And sometimes what we call ‚Äúintuition‚Äù is actually our brain detecting something off‚Äîeven when we can‚Äôt articulate why.So here‚Äôs what I did: I sat with that feeling, but I didn‚Äôt stop there. I forced myself to go find the facts to justify the feelings.Because while I don‚Äôt believe in building a business on emotion, I do believe in using intuition as a prompt‚Äîand then using data to make a final decision.Inside this episode, I‚Äôll walk you through:The opportunity I turned down and why it was so hard to say noThe process I use to reverse-engineer my intuition into factsHow I define ‚Äúproductive vs. busy‚Äù in my daily work lifeWhy trusting yourself is the best business strategy you‚Äôll ever invest inIf you‚Äôve ever felt torn between logic and gut instinct‚Äîor wondered how to tell when an opportunity is right‚Äîthis episode is for you.Your goals don‚Äôt require you to say yes to everything.Sometimes the most strategic move is walking away.Click >>PLAY<< to hear all of this and:[00:01] Why I turned down a forecasted, on-brand, high-revenue opportunity[03:00] The conflict between logic and intuition‚Äîand how I handle it in business[05:15] What intuition really is (spoiler: it‚Äôs your brain spotting patterns)[06:45] The moment I knew something was ‚Äúoff‚Äù and how I investigated it[08:30] How I flipped my gut instinct into data to justify my decision[11:00] Why being productive doesn‚Äôt always mean being busy‚Äîand how to tell the difference[12:15] The gift of saying no, and what it makes space forListen to Related Episodes:10 Ways To Avoid Getting Stuck in BusinessFive Things My Team and I Do to Stay Productive and Reach Our Goalsüìß Join my¬†Newsletter for a weekly cocktail of insider business strategy, personal reflections, and the journey of being a thought leader. üìßFor full show notes, visit jasminestar.com/podcast/episode536
